p: Interestingly, differences in the four research villages suggest that current educational, health, and economic systems in urban Solomon Islands are not supporting local knowledge. Kolofi is the only village adjacent to a gravel road which improves access to larger towns, markets, schools, and hospitals. Kolofi is also the least dense, least centralized, and most disconnected village; it also has the lowest average medicinal knowledge per resident ( S1 Table). These results confirm previous research, which links community market integration and migration to lower network density and less ecological knowledge, including medicinal plant knowledge [ 42, 99, 100].
